title: Bon Appetit's best new restaurants of 2015
text:
CNN Leadership
Bon Appetit's best new restaurants of 2015 By Melonyce McAfee, CNN Updated 1134 GMT (1834 HKT) August 21, 2015 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 AL's Place: San Francisco, California – AL's Place was named "Restaurant of the Year" by Bon Appetit. What makes this San Francisco spot so special? It's all about the vegetable preparation, writes deputy editor Andrew Knowlton. "The intensity of flavors was revelatory. It was almost as though I'd been eating vegetables in black and white my whole life, and then suddenly everything was in Technicolor." Keep scrolling to see Bon Appetit's other picks for the best new American restaurants of 2015. Hide Caption 1 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Gjusta: Venice, California – A "juice bar-bakery-deli-pizzeria-coffee shop-smokehouse" is one of the top restaurants in the whole country? You got that right, says Bon Appetit . The only problem is which delectable offering to choose: "Think of Gjusta as the modern-day version of the Chocolate Room in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory." Hide Caption 2 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Petit Trois: Los Angeles, California – The fact that this French-style bistro sits in a Los Angeles strip mall doesn't detract from its charm, says Knowlton, because the menu more than makes up for its location. "It's a greatest hits of bistro standards executed at a level that's nearly impossible to find anymore — even in Paris." Hide Caption 3 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Semilla: Brooklyn, New York – Veggies take center stage on Semilla 's carefully crafted menu. This intimate, casual spot offers fine dining to rival the stodgiest of New York restaurants, says Knowlton. "Each visit featured several dishes that I didn't know whether to eat or simply admire." Hide Caption 4 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Parachute: Chicago, Illinois – Bon Appetit editors call Chicago's Parachute a "Korean mom-and-pop shop gone delectably rogue." The restaurant puts a modern twist on traditional dishes like pork buns, dumplings and bibimbap. Hide Caption 5 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Dai Due: Austin, Texas – Dai Due is all about the meat; the restaurant grew out of a farmer's market butcher stand into a "uniquely Texan" eatery. The purveyors source most of their ingredients from within a 200 mile radius of the restaurant. Hide Caption 6 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Kindred: Davidson, North Carolina – Operated by couple Joe and Katy Kindred, Kindred is a relatively casual joint that specializes in traditional Southern food with a European twist. Bon Appetit calls it "the ultimate small-town restaurant." Hide Caption 7 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Rintaro: San Francisco, California – Rintaro is an izakaya (a Japanese pub) where the menu "melds traditional Japanese technique with an almost maniacal dedication to California produce," Knowlton writes. Hide Caption 8 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Manolin: Seattle, Washington – The nautically themed restaurant specializes in serving fresh seafood catches, but what really caught the Bon Appetit editors' attention was their seasonal mole recipe , a 26-ingredient Mexican-style sauce that's the "star" of the menu. Hide Caption 9 of 10 10 photos: Bon Appetit: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 Milktooth: Indianapolis, Indiana – Specializing in breakfast and lunch dishes, the daytime-only eatery Milktooth "proves that brunch can — no, should — be the most interesting, inspiring, and ridiculously delicious meal of the day," according to Knowlton. Hide Caption Story highlights AL's Place in San Francisco was named "Restaurant of the Year" by Bon Appetit magazine Other selections for the top 10 restaurants of the year include a brunch spot and a Japanese pub (CNN) After crunching the numbers and chewing the fat, Bon Appetit magazine has come up with its list of the best new American restaurants of 2015 . Traversing the country in search of fresh and innovative cuisine, deputy editor Andrew Knowlton and senior editor Julia Kramer dined at hundreds of eateries and "consumed too many calories to count," according to the magazine. It might be time for a culinary road trip to visit the restaurants that floated to the top in Bon Appetit's yearly rankings. They're calling the list " The Hot 10: America's Best New Restaurants 2015 ." 1. AL's Place -- San Francisco ("Restaurant of the Year")2. Gjusta -- Venice, California3. Petit Trois -- Los Angeles, California4. Semilla -- Brooklyn, New York5. Parachute -- Chicago, Illinois6. Dai Due -- Austin, Texas7. Kindred -- Davidson, North Carolina8. Rintaro -- San Francisco, California9. Manolin -- Seattle, Washington10. Milktooth -- Indianapolis, Indiana The list appears in Bon Appetit's September Restaurant Issue , which aims to cover "everything new, trendsetting, and innovative in the culinary world."
